results.title: Modernism
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. Post impressionism raised its timid head in Australia around 1915 but started with a disadvantage - rampant nationalism made it an unreceptive age for the brave new visions of Margaret Preston, Grace Cossington-Smith, Roland Wakelin and Roy de Maistre. Narrated by Robert Hughes Suitable for upper secondary level

results.title: Modern weather theory. Part 2. Structure of storms
results.brief_description: This film uses animation and maps to explain normal weather conditions and the atmosphere that creates the prevailing winds. Maps and diagrams also show the zones of the prevailing westerlies, and trade winds, and the way in which warm moist air rises, cools by expansion, loses its moisture by precipitation, and so on.

results.title: Modern Wales
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide Pictures and Peter Hopkinson
results.brief_description: The fluctuating world demand for the wealth which lay beneath the lovely valleys of Wales - her iron, steel and coal - brought severe economic depression. As a consequence, Welsh industry was re-orientated so that it would never again rely on a few basic products.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Carr, World Wide Pictures and Peter Hopkinson

results.title: Modern universities in Germany

results.title: Modern transport in Australia
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films and Alex Ezard
results.brief_description: A brief history of transport in Australia. Various phases, either reconstructed or shown in action, are included: the first mailman, John Conway Burke, delivering by horse; wagons; Cobb & Co. coaches; trains and differences in gauges between States; road transport; aeroplanes in operation, including the Air Beef Lift, Flying Doctor and passenger services. Also includes historical footage of Melbourne and Sydney and emphasises Australia’s need for a vast transport system to develop its great areas.

results.title: Modern town rises from desert - Whyalla
results.brief_description: Whyalla in South Australia, showing aspects of its community life and describing its important industries. Blasting of iron ore, the production of iron and the extensive ship building industry.

results.title: Modern times
results.brief_description: This was, in effect, the swansong of the Tramp in what is basically a ‘silent’ film which makes pointed use of synchronised speech at carefully selected moments. In a series of set pieces, in turn cynical and ironic, sentimental and nostalgic, Charlie unsuccessfully assumes a variety of occupations from assembly line worker to singing waiter. In between he becomes one of the unemployed, a willing prisoner and the companion of a working class girl. The film begins as social satire but Chaplin’s factory is too stylised to give the humor much bite. The film is ultimately more about homelessness than modernity. Chaplin’s political and philosophical naivete is disarming. His comic genius as a performer is timeless. Cast also includes Paulette Goddard and Chester Conklin.

results.title: Modern times
results.creator_credit: Graeme Isaac, Mayfan, Film Australia and Graham Chase
results.brief_description: An affectionate portrait of Port Pirie, the South Australian port and smelting town in which filmmaker, Graham Chase, grew up in the ‘50s and ‘60s. This is not merely a sentimental return to the long distant past. Rather, “Modern Times” presents an intimate insight into contemporary survival in an industrial town in decline, a story told with a mixture of empathy, scepticism and humour. Through the eyes of the “mates” who stayed behind in the town Graham Chase left, we receive a vivid picture of a small community facing an uncertain future as it struggles with new industries, the deadly legacy of lead pollution from the smelters and limited employment prospects.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graeme Isaac, Mayfan, Film Australia and Graham Chase

results.title: Modern surgery
results.creator_credit: March of Time, Inc. and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description: Discusses the resources and techniques of the modern hospital. Follows the case history of Mrs Conrad whose urgent need of an operation was a cause of consternation and fear. She receives advice and assurance from her family physician, enters hospital and finds herself in skilled hands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: March of Time, Inc. and Time-Life Films
